name: redolently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that strongly makes you think of something: The album features ten magnificently composed, redolently autobiographical tracks. She wanted to redolently capture the feeling of the late 1970s in her design.
More examplesFewer examplesThis was at a time when the prevailing artistic culture in the eastern Mediterranean remained redolently Greek.This most redolently symbolic of all London's streets illustrates the different sides of English identity.Many of the pieces look so distinctly and redolently of their time.
